cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 575 miles SE of Cape Fear, North Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: The hurricane is moving west-northwest across the southwest Atlantic and is forecast to slow dramatically late Thursday, then curl inland across the North- and South-Carolina coast before drifting west/northwest across the southern Appalachians and Mid-Atlantic states.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the North Carolina coast (Cape Fear – Wilmington area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch from the NC/VA border northward to Cape Charles Light, VA and Chesapeake Bay south of New Point Comfort
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane warning South Santee River, SC to Duck, NC – Storm-surge warning and tropical-storm warning in the same stretch
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Primary impact focus on the Carolina shoreline with secondary heavy-rain/flood impacts extending into the Mid-Atlantic states (VA, MD, DE, southern PA).
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤13%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts to gale force possible late weekend as remnants pass west of the bay.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge threat for Baltimore; only minor tidal anomalies (≤1–2 ft) possible in the upper Chesapeake Bay with prolonged easterly fetch.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches of rain possible Sunday–Monday with locally higher totals producing urban and river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Fresh-water flooding may impede truck/rail access to the marine terminals; reduced visibility and debris on channels from runoff could disrupt vessel movements.
